channel.title: Free the Geek.fm with Matthew Setter
channel.description: A fireside chat on the ins and outs of being a freelance writer, screencaster, teacher, and software developer. Looking at what it’s like to do it, warts and all, as well as how to get started, what to expect, the good, the bad, and the ugly. When we’re not talking that, we’re talking tech, code, apps, development, and of course PHP.
channel.itunes:author: FreetheGeek.fm with Matthew Setter
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast about the business of freelancing as a software developer, writer, content producer, and all round PHP lover
channel.itunes:summary: A fireside chat on the ins and outs of being a freelance writer, screencaster, teacher, and software developer. Looking at what it’s like to do it, warts and all, as well as how to get started, what to expect, the good, the bad, and the ugly. When we’re not talking that, we’re talking tech, code, apps, development, and of course PHP.

item.title: Item 002 – Discussing the Mythical Man Month with Paul M. Jones; plus speaking at php[world] and Nomad PHP.
item.dc:creator: settermjd
item.description: In this episode, I have a fireside chat with internationally recognized PHP expert, and all around good fella Paul M. Jones, about one of his all-time favorite books - The Mythical Man Month. We talk about why the book is so valuable to him, how it's helped shape his career over the years, and the lessons it can teach all of us as software developers, lessons still relevant over 40 years after it was first published, in 1975. I've also got updates on what's been happening for me personally in my freelancing business; including speaking at php[world], attending the inaugural PHP South Coast, and much, much more.

channel.item:
In this episode, I have a fireside chat with voice of the PHP community, the one and only, Cal Evans, about one of his books - Going Pro. http://freethegeek.fm/episode/episode-0003 http://freethegeek.fm/episode/episode-0003/#comments Mon, 17 Aug 2015 06:00:00 +0200 settermjd freelancing In this episode, I have a fireside chat with voice of the PHP community, the one and only, Cal Evans, about one of his books - Going Pro. We talk about a range of things, including what motivated him to write the book, how the book's been received, people Cal believes are excellent examples of professional programmers, and much, much more. Join me for what is a truly excellent fireside chat about some of the key aspects of being a professional.
